c4

Class ConnectFour

  • java.lang.Object
    • c4.ConnectFour
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlphaBetaAgent, CountPositionsC4, GameState, GenerateSource, NumFourRows, RandomAgent, TDSAgent

    public class ConnectFour
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of the basic methods needed for a Connect-Four-Game. The public methods should be sufficient for normal use. Contains: the board-representation (Board is coded as bitboard internally). Methods to put pieces on the Board and remove them again, to find Wins / Draw, to generate move-lists and much more
    Author:
    Markus Thill

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectFour

        public ConnectFour()
        Generate an empty Board

      • ConnectFour

        public ConnectFour(int[][] field)
        Parameters:
        field - a 7x6 Connect-Four Board: 1 -> Player 1 (Beginner) 2 -> Player 2

      • ConnectFour

        public ConnectFour(long fieldP1,
           long fieldP2)
        Create a new Board
        Parameters:
        fieldP1 - BitBoard of Player1
        fieldP2 - BitBoard of Player2

      • ConnectFour

        public ConnectFour(long fieldP1,
           long fieldP2,
           int[] colHeight)
        Copy-Constructor for ConnectFour. Only use, if necessary. Make sure, that the colHeight-Array contains the correct heights for each column, otherwise you will get severe problems!!!
        Parameters:
        fieldP1 - BitBoard of Player1
        fieldP2 - BitBoard of Player2
        colHeight - Array, containing the heights of all 7 columns

    • Method Detail

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(long fieldP1,
            long fieldP2)
        Set the Board to the new Values
        Parameters:
        fieldP1 - Board of Player1 as BitBoard(Beginning player)
        fieldP2 - Board of Player2 as BitBoard

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(int[][] field)
        The internal representation of the board are two BitBoards an array containing the heights of each column. Arrays have to be converted in this form
        Parameters:
        field - 7x6 Array-representation of the Board

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard()
        get the current board
        Returns:
        7x6-Array of the board

      • getWinRows

        public int[] getWinRows(int player)
        Get all Winning-Rows for one player (if existing)
        Parameters:
        player - search for this player
        Returns:
        Array of all pieces that are within a Winning-Row. Even indexes represent the column, even indexes the row

      • fieldToHuffman

        protected int fieldToHuffman(long f1,
                 long f2,
                 boolean mirrored)
        Convert board into a special huffman-code representation. Is needed for the opening-books.
        Parameters:
        f1 - Bitboard of player1
        f2 - BitBoard of player2
        mirrored - true, if f1 and f2 are the mirrored Bitboards of the board
        Returns:

      • generateMoves

        public int[] generateMoves(int player,
                  boolean sameLength)
        Get all legal moves for the player. Order the most promising moves to the front of the board.
        Parameters:
        player -
        sameLength - If sameLength = true, then always a moveList with 8 elements is returned, where a value of -1 indicates the end of the list-
        Returns:
        List of all possible moves

      • generateMoves

        public int[] generateMoves(boolean sameLength)
        Like ConnectFour#generateMoves(int), but without move-ordering.
        Parameters:
        sameLength - If sameLength = true, then always a moveList with 8 elements is returned, where a value of -1 indicates the end of the list-
        Returns:
        List of possible moves for the current state.

      • getBestMove

        public int getBestMove(int player,
              int[] colHeight,
              double[] vTable)
        Parameters:
        player -
        colHeight - Array with the Height of all Columns
        vTable - Values of each Column
        Returns:
        Move, that gets the best Value from vTable

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
